front.title: Marking-based Direct Export for On-path Telemetry

abstract.t: The document describes a packet-marking variation of the IOAM DEX option, referred to as PBT-M (i.e., Postcard-Based Telemetry by Marking). Similar to IOAM DEX, PBT-M does not carry the telemetry data in user packets but send the telemetry data through a dedicated packet. Unlike IOAM DEX, PBT-M does not require an extra instruction header. However, PBT-M raises some unique issues that need to be considered. This document formally describes the high level scheme and cover the common requirements and issues when applying PBT-M in different networks. PBT-M is complementary to the other on-path telemetry schemes such as IOAM trace and E2E options.
